Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the testing results mentioned in the article are five years out of date.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the presence of "illegal amounts" of deadly pesticides in the tea brands.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by inaccurately describing the testing results and not providing up-to-date information.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it relies on outdated testing results.
Problematic assumption: There is no evidence of a problematic assumption in the claim.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the presence of pesticides in the tea brands.
